headline: With New Venture Fund, Robinhood Aims to Give Retail Investors Access to Private Investments
summary: Robinhood  Markets plans to launch a publicly traded venture capital fund to offer mom-and-pop investors exposure to investments in private companies, the brokerage firm announced Monday.  It will be the company’s first fund and highlights a push by Robinhood to expand its offerings of nontraditional investments, including stakes in private companies, which have historically been limited to institutional investors and the wealthy.  “For decades, wealthy people and institutions have invested in private companies while retail investors have been unfairly locked out,” Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev.

raw.headline: With New Venture Fund, Robinhood Aims to Give Retail Investors Access to Private Investments

headline: Alphabet hits $3T, Robinhood's new fund, Broadcom bulls
summary: With Monday's trading day underway, Julie Hyman examines some of the session's trending tickers, including Alphabet's (GOOG, GOOGL) fresh record high, Robinhood's (HOOD) expanded private company investment offerings, and Macquarie initiating coverage of Broadcom (AVGO) with a bullish rating. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Robinhood Unveils New Fund To Open Private Markets To Everyday Investors
summary: Robinhood Markets Inc. (NASDAQ:HOOD) is moving to expand retail investor access to private companies through the launch of Robinhood Ventures Fund I (RVI), a closed-end fund that has filed an initial registration statement on Form N-2 with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The fund will be managed by Robinhood Ventures DE, LLC, a newly created, wholly owned subsidiary of the company.
